intro: Ditassa subulata, commonly known as the narrowleaf dittander, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its slender, needle-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in dense, conical heads. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
